column3: School of Life and Health Sciences
column5: This was the first MSc in Clinical Nutrition to be established in the UK and has gained an international reputation, attracting students from around the world. You will consider the patient’s journey from birth to extreme age in the context of the metabolic response to injury or to chronic disease.  This course is accredited by the Association for Nutrition. The programme is designed for all members of nutrition support teams and is also suitable for students who wish to pursue clinically-based nutrition research.
column7: Please see the university website for further information on fees for this course.
column9: 1 year full time / 2-4 years part time
